title: Module Cache Corruption - Changes Not Visible Despite Source Updates
summary: Next.js 15.2.3 dev server served stale compiled bundles despite confirmed source code changes. Multiple cache purges, process kills, and module invalidations failed. Root cause: Multiple zombie processes + duplicate source files + aggressive module caching.
impact: Complete inability to see UI changes in browser. 2 hours debugging time wasted.
root_cause: Next.js Fast Refresh module cache locked onto old version. Contributing factors: 3 concurrent dev servers, duplicate AppSidebar.tsx in /design-dashboard-mockup, OS-level module caching.
successful_solution: Production build (pnpm build && pnpm start) bypasses dev cache entirely
prevention_checklist: Kill port before starting: lsof -ti:PORT | xargs kill -9
Test structural changes in production build
